briefTitle: Cerebral Oximetry and Neurological Outcomes in Aortic Arch Surgery Patients
officialTitle: Effect of Regional Cerebral Oxygen Saturation Monitoring On Neurological Outcome In Patients Undergoing Aortic Arch Surgery
summary: The investigators hypothesize that early intervention to optimize regional cerebral oxygenation detected by cerebral oximetry monitoring during deep hypothermic circulatory arrest (DHCA) for patients undergoing aortic surgery will decrease the incidence of transient and permanent neurological dysfunction and improve neurocognitive impairment.
